newsitem.title: UK: Iran bought 30,000 t raw sugar at $280/tonne - trade.
newsitem.headline: Iran bought 30,000 t raw sugar at $280/tonne - trade.

text.p: Iran bought 30,000 tonnes of raw sugar at a price believed to be $280 per tonne, trade sources said on Monday.
The shipment period was August, they added.
Traders said Iran -- recently more a buyer of whites -- was last thought to have bought raws in March from a French house, when it took 30,000 tonnes at $273 per tonne for May shipment.

Last week Turkey's state sugar refiner Turkseker said it was planning to sell about 135,000 tonnes of sugar to be destined to Iran and Iraq via local traders at around $15 to $35 per tonne over Paris prices.
